sn2.25:1.2: Normally kuṭikā is understood as a diminutive of kuṭi, hence “little hut”. But here several mendicants are staying (as at Ud 4.2:1.3), while elsewhere the Buddha stayed in one while at the Jetavana (DN 14:1.1.2). More likely the suffix here does not change the meaning of kuṭi.
sn2.25:2.1: The deity Jantu (“man”, “offspring”) cannot be identified.
sn2.25:4.4: Monks falling asleep inappropriately is addressed in the Vinaya (Bu Pc 5, Bu Ss 1:2.1.1, Kd 8:16.1.1; see also Kd 1:7.2.2). | Mucchita in Pali usually means “infatuated, besotted”, but the normal meaning of Sanskrit mūrchita is “fainted, passed out”.
